results.title: Physical facilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Describes the steps in organising physical facilities of a new enterprise: 1) location from the aspect of available facilities; 2) type of building suited to the enterprise; 3) the arrangement and position of the buildings; 4) plant layout from the aspect of type production.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sam Kluk loved his beautiful town of Kuranda in Northern Queensland. Unfortunately, there was another side to the quiet town and Kluk was determined to take every opportunity to escape it.

results.title: Product development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The film considered the following: (1) The role of research in improving materials processes and product; (2) the qualifications for acceptable product ideas such as production requirements in relation to existing facilities; (3) and aspects of product engineering.

results.title: Join the navy and see the world they say
results.creator_credit: Ron Baguley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Inspired by his childhood hero, ‘Uncle Jack’, Ron Baguley enlisted in the Navy at the ripe age of 16. “Join the Navy and see the world they say!” In 1952, Ron was plucked from his job as a carpenter and thrown into a life at sea, serving initially in the Korean Conflict. Ron tracks his incredibly journey from a young recruit to a senior warrant officer.
results.title_for_label: Join the navy and see the world they say
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Baguley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Materials control
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The job of getting the right material in proper amounts to the right place at the right time is described under three materials-control functions of management: (1) Procurement; (2) inventory control; and (3) control of handling and transportation of materials in the production process.

results.title: Arthropods: millipedes, centipedes, crustaceans... (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Of the eight animal species that of the arthropoda is the largest and biologically most successful. Using microphotography the film briefly but clearly explains various functions and activities of some members of the species. An up-close and personal look at millipedes, centipedes, crustaceans, arachnids and insects.

results.title: Life in the Kimberleys
results.creator_credit: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rhys Bedford has a lot of doors open to him, now that he is the recipient of a scholarship at Hale College in Western Australia. But it is when he returns to his family in Kununurra that Bedford gets to explore and reconnect with his country and heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Production control. Part II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The three final steps in production control scheduling, despatching, and follow up demonstrates the use of the master schedule and of the shop schedule, and how despatching in both centralised and de-centralised forms.

results.title: Big blip, small blip
results.creator_credit: Knox McKenzie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Trained as a radar operator, Knox McKenzie saw himself posted around Australia throughout World War II, and eventually on Melville Island. It was an isolating job, waiting for signal “blips” to pick up planes coming in. A big blip was a friend and a small blip was a foe. McKenzie’s innate independance helped him to see the entire experience as an education and one to remember for the rest of his life.

results.title: Indigenous Youth Leadership Programme Scholars : Digital storytelling workshop
results.brief_description: Seven digital stories from young Indigenous people about their upbringing, lives, family, friends, their hopes for the future and what it is like to grow up as an Indigenous Australian.
